place.name: LLANYBRI
place.gazetteerText: LLANYBREE, a chapelry, with a village, in Llanstephan parish, Carmarthen; on the river Towy, opposite Ferryside r. station, and 3¼ miles E of Langharne. Post town, Laugharne, under St. Clears. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of St. David's. Value, £150.* Patron, Miss Lloyd. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
